title: Internet Issues
body:
I changed my username yesterday and since then I've been having issues with the game.

When I load the client I have been disconnected from PVP.net and then my internet stops working all together on my laptop. My phone on the wifi seems to be fine, as do other devices connected to the wifi, but my laptop ceases working and requires to be shutdown and turned back on before I can use the internet again.

I tried flushing my DNS today and running as administrator but upon relainching the client I found the custom game I tested had me dropping frames and the sound was playing up.

I uninstalled the League client and was in the process of reinstalling when my internet started playing up again.

Any help or advice on how to resolve this issue would be greatly appreciated.

replies.body:
Are you using Windows? Did you change your OS user-name or your user-name in League? And if League, then was it just your Summoner Name or did you change your user-name (is that even possible?)?

Anyway, I had issues with trying to reinstall League. A quick solution is to find a computer which has League installed on it, and copy and paste all the game files from it over to the computer you want to reinstall on. Might cause version issues, though, so make sure the computer you're copying from has the latest version of League.

If that's not possible, then try manually setting your DNS. Flush and reset.

Then try setting your IP to static. Some ISPs like to automatically set you some really absurd ones.

If you need any instructions on how to do any of these, reply to this comment with what you need. Best of luck.
